Alliant Energy provides regulated electric and natural gas service to approximately 1,000,000 electric and approximately 430,000 natural gas customers in the Midwest . IPL provides utility services to incorporated communities as directed by the IUC and utilizes non-exclusive franchises, which cover the use of public right-of-ways for utility facilities in incorporated communities for a maximum term of 25 years . WPL supplies electricity to wholesale customers in Minnesota, Illinois and Iowa .
 At December 31, 2024, WPL supplied electric and natural gas service to approximately 500,000 and 200,000 retail customers, respectively . WPL operates in municipalities pursuant to permits of indefinite duration and state statutes authorizing utility operation in areas annexed by a municipality . Alliant Energy’s non-utility holdings are organized under AEF, which manages a portfolio of wholly-owned subsidiaries and additional holdings .
 At December 31, 2024, Alliant Energy, IPL and WPL had the following full- and part-time employees . The majority of IPL’s bargaining unit employees are covered by the International Brotherhood of Electrical Workers Local 204 (Cedar Rapids) collective bargaining agreement, which expires August 31, 2028 .
 Alliant Energy is committed to providing a safe environment for our employees, visitors, customers, contractors, vendors and the communities in which we live and work . We use a formal safety management system to capture and track best practices, near misses, job site briefings, safety observations, safety conversations and any unsafe conditions . Public safety is equally important, as we interact with our customers to provide energy to their homes and businesses .
 Alliant Energy offers employees choice and control, and help support their financial, physical, and mental well-being . Short- and long-term incentive plans have a mix of operational and financial metrics that align employees with strategic corporate goals . The company awards up to 25 scholarships to children of its current employees and eligible retirees .
 Alliant Energy believes the achievement of its strategic objectives can only be achieved with a focused and engaged workforce . It is one of our Values - “Care for others: Together we create a workplace where people feel like they can use their backgrounds, talents and perspectives to their fullest potential” The company offers various learning opportunities for employees, such as participating in area summits, listening sessions, providing training opportunities, and hosting speakers .
 Alliant Energy, IPL and WPL are subject to regulation by various federal, state and local agencies . Early careers programs that include apprenticeships, youth programs (high school) and internships (college) The apprenticeship program combines supervised, structured on-the-job training with related instruction to produce highly skilled trade and technical workers .
 FERC also has jurisdiction, under the Federal Power Act of 1935, over certain electric utility facilities and operations, electric wholesale sales, interstate electric transmission rates, dividend payments, issuance of IPL’s securities . FERC has authority over IPL's and WPL's wholesale electric market-based rates . The Midwest Reliability Organization, which is a regional member of North American Electric Reliability Corporation, has direct responsibility for mandatory electric reliability standards .
 IPL is subject to regulation by the IUC for various matters including retail utility rates and standards of service, accounting requirements, the construction of EGUs, and the acquisition, sale or lease of assets with values that exceed 3% of IPL’s revenues . FERC has authority over certain natural gas facilities and operations of the IPL and WPL .
 IPL is required to file an energy efficiency plan (EEP) every five years with the IUC . IPL must obtain a certificate of public convenience, use and necessity (GCU Certificate) in order to construct a new, or significantly alter an existing, EGU or energy storage facility located in Iowa with a nameplate generating capacity of 25 MW .
 Iowa law allows Iowa utilities to request rate-making principles prior to making certain investments in Iowa . IPL may file for, and the IUC must render a decision on, rate- making principles for certain new EGUs located in Iowa, including alternate energy production facility (such as a wind, solar, energy storage or nuclear-fired facility), combined-cycle natural gas-fired EGU .
 IPL may submit an updated emissions plan and budget to the IUC setting out a multi-year plan for managing regulated emissions from its coal-fired EGUs . cits will be capped at $3 million in aggregate per year . At the end of the program, any accumulated deficit balance would be addressed in IPL’s next rate review, and any accumulated surplus balance would not result in any return to IPL .
 WPL contributes 1.2% of its annual retail utility revenues to help fund Focus on Energy, Wisconsin’s state-wide energy efficiency and renewable energy resource program . WPL must obtain a CPCN from the PSCW in order to construct a new EGU (including energy storage) in Wisconsin with a capacity of 100 MW with a project cost of $16.3 million or more .
 Wisconsin law provides Wisconsin utilities with the opportunity to request rate-making principles prior to the purchase or construction of any EGU utilized to serve Wisconsin customers . WPL is not obligated to file for or accept authorized rates under Wisconsin law . Alliant Energy, IPL and WPL are subject to regulation of environmental matters by federal, state and local authorities .
 The following are major environmental matters that could potentially have a significant impact on financial condition and results of operations . The primary GHG directly emitted from Alliant Energy’s utility operations is CO2 from the combustion of fossil fuels at its EGUs . The EPA enacted the final Section 111(d) rule under the CAA for certain fossil-fueled EGUs in May 2024 .
 In 2015, the EPA published final standards under Section 111(b) of the CAA, which establish CO2 emissions limits for certain new fossil-fueled EGUs . The final rule does not apply to EGUs that are retired by January 2032 . If WPL’s coal-fired Columbia Energy Center is retired by the end of 2029, the final rule would not be applicable; however, if WPL converts Columbia Unit 1 and/or Unit 2 to natural gas, then the rule would be applicable .
 Cross-State Air Pollution Rule is a regional sulfur dioxide and nitrogen oxides cap-and-trade program . Compliance with emission limits may be achieved by purchasing emission allowances and/or reducing emissions through changes in operations or the additions of environmental controls . In 2023, the EPA finalized revisions to the CSAPR state-specific ozone season nitrogen Oxides emission caps and utility-specific emission allowances for certain states, including Wisconsin, beginning in 2023; however, these revisions were stayed by the Supreme Court in June 2024 .
 In December 2024, the EPA proposed updates to the NSPS for combustion turbines built, reconstructed, or modified after December 13, 2024 . This proposal would establish more stringent emission limits for nitrogen oxides emissions and retain the current sulfur dioxide emission limits . Alliant Energy, IPL and WPL are currently evaluating the proposed rule and are unable to predict with certainty future compliance impacts .
 Alliant Energy, IPL and WPL have coal ash ponds at current and former EGU sites, and active and inactive CCR landfills, that are impacted by this rule . The revised CCR Rule significantly expands the scope of regulation, and as discussed in  Note 1-2-3, Alliant is unable to predict with certainty the future outcome of these updates, including resolution of ongoing litigation .
 Alliant Energy’s electric utility operations are located in the Midwest . IPL provides retail and wholesale electric service in Iowa and WPL in Wisconsin . Electric sales are seasonal to some extent with the annual peak normally occurring in the summer months due to air conditioning requirements . The wholesale power market is competitive and IPL also sells electricity to wholesale customers .
 Alliant Energy’s strategy includes actions to retain current customers and attract new customers . IPL and WPL compete against independent power producers, other utilities and MISO market purchases . Long-term generation plans are intended to meet growing customer demand, reduce air emissions and water impacts, reduce reliance on wholesale market purchases and mitigate the impacts of future EGU retirements .
 MISO’s resource adequacy process includes capacity planning reserve margins and capacity accreditation requirements with four distinct seasons . Seasonal accredited capacity values are determined for certain classes of generating resources, including higher accredited capacity for wind generation during the Spring, Fall and Winter seasons . Alliant Energy, IPL and WPL plan to construct and/or acquire additional renewable, energy storage and natural gas resources to meet the requirements .
